definition: to retire/to leave work and rest (euphemism for compulsory retirement of old cadres)
to leave/to part from/to be away from/(in giving distances) from/without (sth)/independent of/one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing fire/☲
to rest/to stop doing sth for a period of time/to cease/(imperative) don't

sentences.english: When a constipation suggestion retired old person goes to the bathroom, faints suddenly in the place.
sentences.chinese: 便秘诱发型一离休老人如厕时，突然晕倒在地。

sentences.english: He was vice-director of disciplinary examination committee of Guangzhou Military Area.
sentences.chinese: 离休前为广州军区纪律检查委员会副主任。

sentences.english: The state shall encourage veteran cadres to settle in the countryside or in small or medium-sized cities or towns.
sentences.chinese: 国家鼓励离休干部到农村或中小城镇安家落户。

sentences.english: Cadres who have already retired but meet the qualifications mentioned above shall likewise be treated as veteran cadres.
sentences.chinese: 已经退休的干部，符合上述规定的应当改为离休。

definition: to change one's profession/to transfer to civilian work
family or dependents of martyr (in PRC, esp. revolutionary martyr)
Resist US, help North Korea (1950s slogan)
lit. to nurture one's years (idiom)/fig. to enjoy one's later years
to join a political party (esp. the Communist Party)
to transfer/to move to another post
